SEARCH
Package DataStructures.LinkedList

Class LinkedList<T>

java.lang.Object
DataStructures.LinkedList.LinkedList<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements stored in this list
public class LinkedList<T> extends Object
LinkedList represents a generic doubly-linked list that maintains references to both the head and tail nodes for efficient insertion and removal at both ends. Each node contains bidirectional pointers enabling traversal in both directions. Tracks list size for O(1) size queries and supports iteration through anonymous inner classes.

  • Constructor Details

    • LinkedList

      public LinkedList()
      Creates a new empty LinkedList with no elements. Initializes head and tail to null and size to zero.

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(T element)
      Appends the specified element to the end of this list. If the list is empty, the element becomes both head and tail. Otherwise, links the element to the current tail and updates tail reference. Operates in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      element - the element to be appended to this list

    • add

      public void add(DoubleNode<T> newNode)
      Appends the specified pre-constructed node to the end of this list. Useful for reusing existing node structures from other data structures. Performs identical linking logic as add(T element) but accepts a node directly. Operates in O(1) time.
      Parameters:
      newNode - the DoubleNode to be appended to this list

    • removeFirst

      public void removeFirst() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Removes and discards the element at the head of this list. Updates head reference to the next node and clears its previous pointer. If removal empties the list, sets tail to null for consistency. Operates in O(1) time.
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the list is empty

    • removeLast

      public void removeLast() throws EmptyCollectionException
      Removes and discards the element at the tail of this list. Handles the special case of single-element lists by clearing both head and tail. For multi-element lists, updates tail to previous node and clears its next pointer. Operates in O(1) time.
      Throws:
      EmptyCollectionException - if the list is empty

    • get

      public T get(int index)
      Returns the element at the specified index in this list. Traverses from head node sequentially to reach the target index. Valid indices range from 0 (head) to size-1 (tail). Operates in O(n) time due to linear traversal requirement.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the element to return (0-based)
      Returns:
      the element at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is negative or greater than or equal to size

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements in this list.
      Returns:
      the number of elements currently in this list

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this list is empty, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true if the list contains no elements, false otherwise

    • iterator

      public Iterator<T> iterator()
      Returns an iterator for traversing elements in this list from head to tail. Creates an anonymous inner class implementing the Iterator interface. The iterator maintains a current node reference that advances with each next() call.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that traverses this list from beginning to end

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this list. Constructs a string by concatenating the string representation of each element separated by newlines, traversing from head to tail. Operates in O(n) time.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string containing all elements in this list, one per line
